note.p: Birth: Alfred Street, Liverpool, England (01 September 1835)
Death: Galley Hill, Bulverhythe, near Hastings, Sussex (13 August 1882)
Research Field: Logic, economics, philosophy of science

Career: Assayer to the Mint, Sydney, Australia (1853-1859); Professor of Logic and Political Economy, Owens College, Manchester (1866-1879); Professor of Political Economy, University College, London (1876-1880); Examiner in Political Economy in the University of London; drowned while bathing
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1883 vol 35 pp i-xii signed by R H
Notes: B Stewart and Charles Babbage have both signed the election certificate twice
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
